fields.summary: Node controllers should rewrite device names as needed to ensure volumes attach

fields.description:
This could be a back end bug, I don't have euca2ools set up (sorry [~gholms]!) and no time to do that ATM due to prep for a demo. 

I can't attach a volume to a running instance, problem in develop branch as well as on 10.111.5.201. I can't attach a volume from anywhere. I sometimes get a "successfully sent request" notice followed by a heaping helping of nothing, and once I actually got an "unable to attach volume" error message that is utterly lacking in helpful info to diagnose the problem. 

UPDATE: Moving this to a EUCA ticket since the console code to attach a volume hasn't changed since March, and the issue can be reproduced using euca2ools.  Note that when a volume is successfully attached, it takes a *long* time (i.e. well over a minute) for the attachment to complete.
fields.summary: unable to attach volume to instance

comments.body: worked with [~jloza] and could not reproduce this myself.
I am still seeing this when directly connected (no local proxy) to the .201 cloud. (FF or chrome)
I was able to reproduce on https://10.111.5.201/instances/i-09711b1e/volumes using Firefox 34

I was able to attach a volume to an instance using the following…

clchost: 10.111.5.201 (VPC-enabled)
Account: ui-test-acct-02/admin
Environment: Console installed from source
Browser: Firefox 34 on Mac OS 10.8.5

I am unable to attach a volume to an instance using the following…

clchost: 10.111.5.150 (VPC *not* enabled)
Account: ui-test-acct-02/admin
Environment: Console installed from source
Browser: Firefox 34 on Mac OS 10.8.5

[~dkavanagh]: I captured the Boto debug from the attach volume to instance operation (when performed on an instance detail page's Volumes tab) at https://gist.github.com/kamalgill/226e473ac5d3e9579cd8

I set a pdb statement just below the self.conn.attach_volume() call in InstanceVolumesView's instance_volume_attach() method and removed a few lines captured above the self.log_request() call.  Unfortunately, there doesn't seem to be anything wrong based on the response from the back-end since the status returned is 'attaching'.  Could this be a back-end issue, perhaps isolated to non-VPC clouds?  I don't see anything wrong on the console side, and even the back-end is reporting a success even though the attachment of the volume to the instance fails.

/cc [~jloza], [~sjones]

[~dkavanagh], [~kyolee], [~jloza], [~sjones]: I'm unable to attach a volume to an instance on the 10.111.5.201 (VPC-enabled) cloud via euca2ools.

Using euca2ools indicates the attachment succeeds (like the console's success notice), but the volume isn't attached.

{code}
[root@d-21 ~]# euca-attach-volume  -i i-588acf13 -d /dev/sdf vol-ba796855
ATTACHMENT	vol-ba796855	i-588acf13	/dev/sdf	attaching	2014-12-17T23:19:40.973Z
[root@d-21 ~]# euca-describe-volumes --filter volume-id=vol-ba796855
VOLUME	vol-ba796855	1		one	available	2014-12-17T23:17:35.001Z	standard	
TAG	volume	vol-ba796855	Name	kg-volume1
{code}

I ran the euca2ools commands as root on host 10.111.5.201

I am able to reproduce the GUI issue in my non-VPC environment.  I tried attaching a volume using the GUI and was unable to.  I was able to attach the same volume using CLI.  I have notice these errors in the logs.  This error is happening from a volume that was deleted a while ago.  It no longer shows up anywhere in the system.  I do not see errors in eucaconsole.log when trying to attach a volume from the GUI.
{code}
hu Dec 18 10:45:08 2014 ERROR [DASManager:Eucalyptus.storage.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#434] [com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.DASManager.deleteVolume(DASManager.java):532] Cannot delete volume vol-07b41248 because it is currently exported
Thu Dec 18 10:45:08 2014 ERROR [DASManager:Eucalyptus.storage.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#432] [com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.DASManager.deleteVolume(DASManager.java):596] All attempts to cleanup volume vol-07b41248 failed
{code}

I reproduced on system 10.111.5.7

CLI command used to attach volume:
euca-attach-volume -i i-566e8e2b -d /dev/sdf vol-db7633fb
Those errors happened when using the GUI, but not euca2ools?? Are you sure the volume was in the same state each time?

[~dkavanagh]:
I ran this after attaching from the CLI which showed the volume was attached.  I also ssh'd into the instance and verified it was attached.  The errors that I posted have been happening but I can't confirm they are from the GUI attachment problem.  I've been trying to find root cause but have been unable to.
{code}
[root@h-07 ~]# euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME	vol-3a501ece	10		one	available	2014-11-21T21:19:46.281Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-db7633fb	1		one	in-use	2014-12-12T07:55:05.822Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-db7633fb	i-566e8e2b	/dev/sdf	attached	2014-12-18T18:36:26.497Z
{code}

From Instance (/dev/vdc is the volume):
{code}
root@i:~# fdisk -l

Disk /dev/vda: 2147 MB, 2147483648 bytes
4 heads, 32 sectors/track, 32768 cylinders, total 4194304 sectors
Units = sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes
Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes
I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes
Disk identifier: 0x00092f0f

   Device Boot      Start         End      Blocks   Id  System
/dev/vda1   *        2048     4194303     2096128   83  Linux

Disk /dev/vdb: 3221 MB, 3221225472 bytes
16 heads, 63 sectors/track, 6241 cylinders, total 6291456 sectors
Units = sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes
Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes
I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes
Disk identifier: 0x00000000

Disk /dev/vdb doesn't contain a valid partition table

Disk /dev/vdc: 1073 MB, 1073741824 bytes
16 heads, 63 sectors/track, 2080 cylinders, total 2097152 sectors
Units = sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes
Sector size (logical/physical): 512 bytes / 512 bytes
I/O size (minimum/optimal): 512 bytes / 512 bytes
Disk identifier: 0x00000000

Disk /dev/vdc doesn't contain a valid partition table
{code}
[~dkavanagh], [~kgill], [~jloza]: I discovered that, for me, this was related to the landing page.  I can attach using the details page.

Testing on the 5.150 cloud, I can attach a volume to an instance via the volumes landing page, the volume detail page, and the instance-volumes page using the eucalyptus/admin account, but the attach operation takes *A FEW MINUTES* to complete.

Following up on failures on 10.111.5.201 VPC cloud. On UI the device for attaching volume defaults to /dev/sdf which is good for AWS, but dev/sd* will not work for hvm images. I could attach volume to devices starting with /dev/vdc.
[~jloza] there is no message in command line either when attach operation fails.
sounds like we need to update some stuff in the console...
